chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Jamal Fairley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Consecutive to underlying sentence in 12CF295 and 13CF297.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-No credit until Defendant has completed his sentence in underlying cases.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: 12CF295 and 13CF297

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF229.

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Michael Croes.

CO: RMW, REP: Olson, CLERK: LiddleADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp   DF:  Jesse Jamal Fairley appeared from jail. Case called at 11:47 a.m. This is the date and time set for sentencing. ADA Nieskes hands court of the restitution request from Mr. Crowe. Atty Kemp objects to the amount of restitution to be paid to the insurance company. Atty Kemp has received a copy of the PSI. ADA Nieskes will follow the recommendations of the PSI. Gives sentencing arguments. Victims are not present but court is in receipt of letter from Victim. Atty Kemp gives sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to appeal. Court orders on 15CF229:

On Count 1- Escape
Bifurcated Sentence
5 years total confinement
3 years initial confinement, 2 years ES consecutive to underlying sentence 12CF295 and 13CF297. Run concurrent to Ct.2 and consecutive to underlying sentence in 12CF295 and 13CF297

On Count 2- Take and Drive without owner consent
Bifurcated Sentence
5 years total confinement 
3 years initial confinement, 2 years ES consecutive to underlying sentence 12CF295 and 13CF297. Run concurrent to Ct.1 and consecutive to underlying sentence in 12CF295 and 13CF297

- No jail credit until defendant has completed sentence in underlying case

- Restitution in the amount of $2,873.68 made joint and several with Mr. Peterson and Mr. Vance paid to Mr. Crowe. Wage assignment put into place so prison wages can go towards Restitution. Court will reserve on the restitution requested for the insurance company

- Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mr.Crowe, his family or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.
Filed by Def. Re: case. km
Sentencing hearing at 12-04-2015 11:15 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Benoy   ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp   DF:  Jesse Jamal Fairley appeared from jail.   Case called 8:42  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Cts 1 & 2 w/out repeater.    DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Cts 1 & 2 w/out repeater in 15CF229. On motion of the State, Crt read in and dismisses Ct 3 in 15CF229.  Court orders PSI.   PSI to be prepared by 11/12/15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Review scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 07:45 am.
